content:
TITLE: Basic gspread-pandas usage with CSV data
DESCRIPTION: Example demonstrating how to read a CSV file into a DataFrame and upload it to Google Sheets using gspread-pandas. Shows basic Spread object creation, sheet operations, and client usage for finding spreadsheets in folders.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aiguofer/gspread-pandas/blob/master/README.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import pandas as pd
from gspread_pandas import Spread, Client

file_name = "http://stats.idre.ucla.edu/stat/data/binary.csv"
df = pd.read_csv(file_name)

# 'Example Spreadsheet' needs to already exist and your user must have access to it
spread = Spread('Example Spreadsheet')
# This will ask to authenticate if you haven't done so before

# Display available worksheets
spread.sheets

# Save DataFrame to worksheet 'New Test Sheet', create it first if it doesn't exist
spread.df_to_sheet(df, index=False, sheet='New Test Sheet', start='A2', replace=True)
spread.update_cells('A1', 'B1', ['Created by:', spread.email])
print(spread)
# <gspread_pandas.client.Spread - User: '<example_user>@gmail.com', Spread: 'Example Spreadsheet', Sheet: 'New Test Sheet'>

# You can now first instanciate a Client separately and query folders and
# instanciate other Spread objects by passing in the Client
client = Client()
# Assumming you have a dir called 'example dir' with sheets in it
available_sheets = client.find_spreadsheet_files_in_folders('example dir')
spreads = []
for sheet in available_sheets.get('example dir', []):
    spreads.append(Spread(sheet['id'], client=client))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing gspread-pandas using pip
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the gspread-pandas package using pip package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aiguofer/gspread-pandas/blob/master/README.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: console
CODE:
```
$ pip install gspread-pandas
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing gspread-pandas from source
DESCRIPTION: Commands to clone the gspread-pandas repository and install it from source.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aiguofer/gspread-pandas/blob/master/README.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: console
CODE:
```
$ git clone https://github.com/aiguofer/gspread-pandas.git
$ python setup.py install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Python Package Dependencies
DESCRIPTION: Specifies the required Python packages and version constraints needed to run gspread-pandas. Includes gspread 5.x, pandas 0.20.0+, decorator, and Google authentication packages.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aiguofer/gspread-pandas/blob/master/requirements.txt#2025-04-19_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
gspread>=5.0.0, <6
pandas>=0.20.0
decorator
google-auth
google-auth-oauthlib
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting up the gspread-pandas development environment in console
DESCRIPTION: Commands to clone the gspread-pandas repository, install the package in development mode with all development dependencies, and set up pre-commit hooks for code quality enforcement.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aiguofer/gspread-pandas/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: console
CODE:
```
$ git clone https://github.com/aiguofer/gspread-pandas.git && cd gspread-pandas
$ pip install -e ".[dev]"
$ pre-commit install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Referencing gspread_pandas.spread module in reStructuredText
DESCRIPTION: Documentation directive for the spread module of gspread-pandas, which likely handles spreadsheet operations. The directive includes options to show all members, undocumented members, and inheritance details.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aiguofer/gspread-pandas/blob/master/docs/source/gspread_pandas.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: reStructuredText
CODE:
```
.. automodule:: gspread_pandas.spread
    :members:
    :undoc-members:
    :show-inheritance:
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Referencing gspread_pandas.client module in reStructuredText
DESCRIPTION: Documentation directive for the client module of gspread-pandas, which likely handles API authentication and connection. The directive shows all members, undocumented members, and inheritance details.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aiguofer/gspread-pandas/blob/master/docs/source/gspread_pandas.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: reStructuredText
CODE:
```
.. automodule:: gspread_pandas.client
    :members:
    :undoc-members:
    :show-inheritance:
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Referencing gspread_pandas.conf module in reStructuredText
DESCRIPTION: Documentation directive for the conf module of gspread-pandas, which likely handles configuration and settings. The directive includes options to show all members, undocumented members, and inheritance details.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aiguofer/gspread-pandas/blob/master/docs/source/gspread_pandas.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: reStructuredText
CODE:
```
.. automodule:: gspread_pandas.conf
    :members:
    :undoc-members:
    :show-inheritance:
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Verifying OAuth credentials in external shell for Rodeo compatibility
DESCRIPTION: Command to authenticate with Google API outside of Rodeo to avoid EOF errors. This creates and stores OAuth credentials that can be used later within Rodeo.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aiguofer/gspread-pandas/blob/master/README.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
python -c "from gspread_pandas import Spread; Spread('<user_key>','')"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Recording new betamax test cassettes in console
DESCRIPTION: Command to run tests with recording enabled to create new betamax cassettes for HTTP interactions. Requires Service Account credentials stored as google_secret.json in the project root.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aiguofer/gspread-pandas/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: console
CODE:
```
$ GSPREAD_RECORD=true pytest <path_to_test>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Sphinx Documentation Structure Using toctree
DESCRIPTION: Sets up the documentation structure using Sphinx toctree directives. Organizes the documentation into two main sections - one with maxdepth 5 for main content and another with maxdepth 1 for changelog.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aiguofer/gspread-pandas/blob/master/docs/source/index.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: rst
CODE:
```
.. toctree::
   :maxdepth: 5

   getting_started
   configuration
   using
   modules
   contributing

.. toctree::
   :maxdepth: 1

   changelog
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining RST Documentation Structure
DESCRIPTION: ReStructuredText directive defining a table of contents tree for module documentation, with a maximum depth of 4 levels, referencing the gspread_pandas module.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aiguofer/gspread-pandas/blob/master/docs/source/modules.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: rst
CODE:
```
.. toctree::
   :maxdepth: 4

   gspread_pandas
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Including README File in reStructuredText Documentation
DESCRIPTION: This directive includes the contents of the README.rst file located two directories up from the current file. It's commonly used in Sphinx documentation to incorporate the project's main README into the generated docs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aiguofer/gspread-pandas/blob/master/docs/source/getting_started.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: reStructuredText
CODE:
```
.. include:: ../../README.rst
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Including CONTRIBUTING.rst File in reStructuredText
DESCRIPTION: This directive includes the content of the CONTRIBUTING.rst file located two directories up from the current file. It's used to incorporate contribution guidelines into the documentation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aiguofer/gspread-pandas/blob/master/docs/source/contributing.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: reStructuredText
CODE:
```
.. include:: ../../CONTRIBUTING.rst
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Including External RST File in Sphinx Documentation
DESCRIPTION: Uses the 'include' directive in reStructuredText to incorporate an external file (CHANGELOG.rst) from a relative path. This allows maintaining the changelog in a single location while including it in the documentation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aiguofer/gspread-pandas/blob/master/docs/source/changelog.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: rst
CODE:
```
.. include:: ../../CHANGELOG.rst
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Sphinx Documentation Indices
DESCRIPTION: Standard Sphinx index definitions for generating index pages, module index and search functionality.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aiguofer/gspread-pandas/blob/master/docs/source/index.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: rst
CODE:
```
* :ref:`genindex`
* :ref:`modindex`
* :ref:`search`
```
